subject: RE: [junit] Re: CreateProcess error (JUnit and Visual J++)
msgSnippet: I have heard that there are subtle and not-so subtle differences between Java and VJ++.  If that is true, could these be an issue here? -Jason
messageBody:
I have heard that there are subtle and not-so subtle differences between
Java and VJ++. If that is true, could these be an issue here?

-Jason

> -----Original Message-----
> From: kr1shnak@... [mailto:kr1shnak@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 29, 2001 5:55 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: CreateProcess error (JUnit and Visual J++)
>
>
> Hi,
>
> I am just trying to run the supplied test sample code
> that comes with
> the JUnit distribution. I am using JUnit version 3.7 (from
> www.junit.org). I am using the instructions in the ReadMe
> file: java
> junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
>
> Of course, I substitute jview instead of java, as I am
> using Visual
> J++.
>
> Regards,
>
> Krishna
>
> --- In junit@y..., Hrishikesh <rushi_kesh@y...> wrote:
